meanings.sent1: I had to refrain from eating the delicious cake to stick to my diet.
meanings.sent2: Please refrain from running in the hallway to avoid accidents.
meanings.sent3: I tried to refrain from laughing during the serious meeting, but it was too funny.
meanings.sent4: She had to refrain from speaking her mind to avoid causing a scene.
meanings.sent5: The doctor advised him to refrain from smoking to improve his health.

meanings.definition: A repeated line or verse in a song or poem.
meanings.sent1: The refrain in the song was catchy and easy to remember.
meanings.sent2: The poet used a beautiful refrain to emphasize the theme of the poem.
meanings.sent3: The refrain of the song got stuck in my head all day.
meanings.sent4: The refrain of the poem echoed through the room, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The refrain added a rhythmic quality to the song, making it more enjoyable.

meanings.definition: To abstain from an impulse to say or do something.
meanings.sent1: She had to refrain from blurting out the surprise party plans.
meanings.sent2: It's important to refrain from interrupting others while they speak.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't refrain from making a joke, even in a serious situation.
meanings.sent4: I had to refrain from rolling my eyes at his ridiculous comment.
meanings.sent5: She struggled to refrain from scratching the mosquito bite to avoid making it worse.
